answers.answer: I'm sorry for your loss. I have had anxiety for 15 years, and this sounds like anxiety. The fact that your lost your dad 2 years from yesterday is triggering some strong emotions. Going to counciling for anxiety is great. I think therapy especially cognitive behavioral therapy really helps. Just stay positive and work on tools for your anxiety. Take care

I take sertraline for anxiety.  It works wonders where I no longer feel severely anxious for no reason all the time, but when I get in a situation that warrants anxiety, I think I get more anxious than someone without constant anxiety would.

question: Ok, ive struggled with anxiety for quite a while now.  I try to deal with it by going to counciling, I am not taking any anxity meds at this time!  However, I do take Lisinopril (bp) and Metformin ER (pre-diabetes).  Tomorrow is the anniversary date of my dads passing, its been two years!  Today, I have been so on edge, figety, and just not feeling right!  Could it just be my anxiety?!  Its like Ive had a day long panic attack!!!!  Please if anyone could give me some adivce and let me know if they have any recommendations....  I would greatly appreciate it!!!
title: REALLY COULD USE SOME ADVICE
